answers.answer: my c-section wasnt scheduled but still turned out well.. my little boy is healthy and full of life.. only problem i have is the pain afterward but i wouldnt change having him any other way.

I had a c section with both my daughter's so i have to have it again but all mines turned out fine.....i was not in any pain and was right back up like i did not have surgery....its different for other ppl tho but i say mines went good

I am a ftm and I am doing a c-section as well on the 13th but I know many people that have done it and they all happy. They said just make sure your walk and everything will be good. Good luck and God bless your baby and self
Mine is breech too, and a little chubby. I'm anticipating having to have a cesarean as well. Makes me a bit nervous but not as nervous as I am about trying to deliver and having complications.
My first was a c-section due to baby being breech.  This time I am choosing to, so I can have my tubes tied.  I didn't think it was bad at all. The sooner you get up and move around, the better.
Thanks everyone your comments really helped withmy nerves!! :)

Last baby was a Csection for me. Preeclampsia, cervadil induction, failure to progress, recovery was terrible, my incision got infected. I'm due in 3 days but getting another Csection on the 2nd because apparently my cervix has a mind of it's own and wants to work against me again and stay closed.

I'm having my fourth child. All c sections. I would definitely recommend someone to help you at home for the first week. Every one of them have been easy for me. The pain wasn't unbearable and to be honest I prefer a c section rather than being induced. It's only natural to be nervous. But no matter which way you have your baby it's all worth it in the end. :)Good luck

question: Anybody have any positive c section stories?? I have to get a c section on April 10th because my little boy is still breech with his head high up at my ribs! I'm super nervous and absolutely petrified so only nice stories please lol no horror stories haha :D
title: c section advice :)
